triples.name: Software verification
triples.relevance: SV-COMP 2025 is a competition that evaluates software verification tools and methods for checking program correctness.

triples.name: Witness validation
triples.relevance: The paper introduces a new validation track that analyzes witness-based correctness proofs generated by verification tools.

triples.name: Memory safety
triples.relevance: Memory safety is one of the six core verification specifications evaluated in the SV-COMP 2025 competition.

triples.name: Data race
triples.relevance: Data race detection is a key verification property in the SV-COMP 2025 benchmark for concurrent program analysis.

triples.name: Termination analysis
triples.relevance: Proving program termination is one of the six verification specifications in the SV-COMP 2025 competition.

triples.name: Reachability analysis
triples.relevance: Reachability checking is a foundational verification specification tested extensively across all SV-COMP 2025 benchmark tasks.

triples.name: Buffer overflow
triples.relevance: Buffer overflows are covered under the memory safety and overflow specifications in the SV-COMP 2025 verification tasks.

triples.name: Assertion (software development)
triples.relevance: Assertion validity is a key verification specification for Java programs in the SV-COMP 2025 competition.

triples.name: Exception handling (programming)
triples.relevance: Runtime exception detection is evaluated as a demonstration category for Java programs in SV-COMP 2025.
